website_summaries.verdict: The latest computer from Wahoo, which has a color screen and updated mapping features.
pros: This bike computer is very customizable and can pair with various sensors, including electronic drivetrains for gear status and battery
Can live sync with popular cycling apps for live segments and real-time data
Battery life of up to 17 hours
Options to increase font size for visibility
cons: All the bells and whistles mean this computer is a bit complicated

customer_reviews.title: Excellent computer! I have a garmin edge 500 and ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer! I have a garmin edge 500 and 800. Never made the upgrade to 520 or 820 because while they made improvements, the new screens were garbage. The screen on the elemnt is crisp and clear in all conditions. The best part may be the incredibly easy set up with the app. Also, it pairs flawlessly and easily with all devices and integrates with third party apps. One of the most annoying things with my garmin was how regularly it would drop the signal from my power meter. Garmins are everywhere, but this just may be a better choice overall!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Teifke

customer_reviews.title: ... County Bikes and Beer ride where a 35 mile fun ride ended up being a 62 mile grind due ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after a San Diego County Bikes and Beer ride where a 35 mile fun ride ended up being a 62 mile grind due to some person's removing the road markers. So far the turn by turn feature is awesome with the Take Me To feature is a life saver. I change the metrics I want to see on the fly and depending on my training needs. I can also pace myself better when Im trying to get a personal best. Not too happy with the original mount. I opted for a K Edge Wahoo combo so I can mount a GoPro and a light.
customer_reviews.author: Ramir

customer_reviews.title: Great bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Great computer for the price. Extremely easy to setup and use as the APP is quick and easy to use. You can move around info on the screen to where you want it and add/remove fields/data you don't need. The fact that it automatically uploads my data to applications like Ride with GPS make it simple to keep track of my rides. I can also create maps and queue sheets with the Ride with GPS application and quickly transfer them to the Wahoo computer. Battery also lasts for multiple multi hour rides between charges. So going the distance is easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to replace the use of phone apps
customer_reviews.text: Previously I used my phone as the bike computer, Samsung s5 with ant+ and the wahoo app. But on longer rides and the age of my phone batteries, I would have very little charge left and didn't like that when riding 60miles... in case I needed my phone for emergency. So this model works as a stand-alone bike computer, (unless using the directional led notification), to which I only need to use my phone when I want to sync after a ride. I like the custom menus and the zoom feature if I only need to see a specific set of items on a page. And it holds a charge for multiple rides.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Glad I switched from Garmin (was kind of surprised how much I liked the Wahoo)
customer_reviews.text: I'd been using a Garmin 705 (I liked it) for 8+ years when it finally gave out. Replaced with a Garmin 520+ which I had to return due to issues with no % grade reading on steep climbs (which I encounter every ride). Decided to give Wahoo a shot and I'm so glad I did. The display is MUCH easier to view. The interface via smartphone is great (compared to navigating all the menus on Garmins). Battery life is excellent. And I was able to use my existing Garmin heart rate strap, cadence and speed sensors. I know riders have different functional priorities for their bike computers based on riding goals, etc. but for me this is a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob's Your Uncle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little device!
customer_reviews.text: The Elemnt is simply amazing. Easily syncs with my routes in Strava or Ride with GPS apps.Provides great turn-by-turn directions and mapping. A minor grudge: I wish the audible turn alerts were louder, but keep an eye on the map and you will get where you are going. The stats are great. I have the Wahoo Cadence monitor that it reads also. Live sync with Strava segments is very cool too. Battery is amazing. I have used it on several 60+ mile rides with navigation on and used less than half the battery.
customer_reviews.author: David Spinelli

customer_reviews.title: WOW, can't believe i used Garmin for so long.
customer_reviews.text: After being a Garmin Loyalist for years I upgraded my old 500. Bouncing around the 520, 820, 1030, for a variety of reasons I choose the Wahoo Element. 2 months later I can't believe I was so loyal to Garmin, what a great unit. Ease of use, great interaction with smart phone and apps, fantastic unit. Almost as if they took the Garmin and said, "lets remove everything people hate and expand on what they love. We'll call it Wahoo Element". Can't give them any points on the name but, 5 stars on the unit and APP.
customer_reviews.author: GDC

customer_reviews.title: Dead after two uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked on two rides. Then the screen locked up, kept showing the Wahoo logo then going blank, over and over again. Followed instructions to re-set (holding power button down) but nothing worked. Someone suggested re-charging, did a re-charge and now it won't turn on at all so it's worthless now. Pity, as the app and ease of use seemed to be there. But $300 for two rides is of course far too much!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike computer
customer_reviews.text: I tested this Wahoo side by side with a Sigma. Sigma has a touch screen that is wonderful. Wahoo is overpriced for its value, but it is a solid unit that is very accurate. It does the job, and if you are already in the Wahoo world, it is very good, but overpriced. I bought the full sized unit for olde eyes to see the stats. the same unit, smaller, is called Bolt, also tested and works just as well if you want smaller footprint and the same stats. I do recommend it. Garmin 1030 is far better, but twice the price. Sigma Rox 12 also far better, but Sigma pulled out of US market.
customer_reviews.author: James Rawie

customer_reviews.title: I love my WAHOO ELEMNT
customer_reviews.text: WAHOO Elemnt is simply amazing. Now I know how good or how bad my ride is because I have all the information at a glance, speed , rpm, distance, incline and much more. Since I have been using the WAHOO Elemnt I have improved my speed and cadence. I’m riding more miles but in less time. It’s great cause it takes out the guess work the information is there as you ride you don’t have to wait till your ride is over to check an app and analyze the data. Although it has GPS, with you smart phone, it needs improvement. It’s an excellent investment if cycling is your passion.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Morales

customer_reviews.title: Better than Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Edge 520. It has served me well. The battery is excellent; After a 2 hour ride, the battery is still over 80% full. The screen is easily readable in sunlight and you can adjust the text size while riding. Note that you need to set up the device using a smartphone (bluetooth) but the phone is not required when riding. One downside is that the calorie counter requires a sensor setup (not included) so my calories are always zero. The other downside is the mounting bracket is poorly designed; I can't mount the GPS on the bike stem like the Garmin can so I had to mount it between my aero bars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I love this device!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thoroughly pleased and impressed with the Wahoo Elemnt bike computer. I've been using it for about a week now and have already noticed an improvement in my fitness. The Elemnt allows me to train to my heart rate and push harder than I have before. My times on my favorite climbs have dropped and I expect will continue to drop. I can move between bikes seamlessly and have been able to connect several speed and cadence sensors. The computer recognizes them immediately!! I also appreciate the battery life. I don't have to worry about the battery not making it to the end of my rides like I did using my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: BruceInBaghdad

customer_reviews.title: I love this! I had a Garmin that was very ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I had a Garmin that was very temperamental and hard to get synced up. With this ELEMNT, everything is super easy. I also like how easy it is to see, and lights indicating your speed above or below your average is a big motivator. Highly recommend the elemnt if you want an easy to use, easy to read bike computer!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Easy to see when riding. Not compatible with my old Garmin mount. Connects to WiFi and my Mio HRM without issue. Routes synchronized easily with Ride with GPS and uploads to Strave automatically. Really like the notifications and display of texts which is handy if someone In the ride group gets separated and sends a note. It’s also nice to see who’s calling without having to reach back for my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Human11

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Like: big screen, good battery. If % grade is important to you dont by this gps. There is a 1 minute lag so any info it gives you is of NO VALUE If temp. is important dont buy this gps. Temp. is always at least 10° to high. Just yesterday it was 63° outside yet Wahoo said 80°. End of ride it was 59°, Wahoo said 70° Also it has no way to teather it to your bike! I would not buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: l.F.

customer_reviews.title: Unable to get important functions to work.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, but not very accurate for power, altitude gain/loss, nor did it show notifications from my phone. Power figures and altitude gained figures qualified me for the Tour de France, and I am 70+ years old. Had to delete all of my Training Peaks data from this computer, because it was so inaccurate. I'll stick with my Garmin, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: cisco

customer_reviews.title: Love my Wahoo!
customer_reviews.text: I transitioned from a phone app to this unit. My brother has this unit too, he got his first. I like the customization you can do with the mobile app to change where and what things are shown on the Elemnt. Easy visibility, cool led's you can have tell you different things. Like that it's NOT touchscreen. Buttons are good, solid feel. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: TCoursey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using bicycle computer for years. The Wahoo Elemnt is the best and newest. Is as advertised, easy to use and setup. Just paired the heart monitor and like everything else works perfectly. Great bike computer. Thinking about getting another for my wife's bike.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Stark

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful in mileage/ elevation stats and family’s awareness of the riders well being
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husbands birthday. He loves it! I love the app I downloaded so I can check and make sure he’s still moving after being gone HOURS over a mountain or through a forest.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: I am a fan.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good device. Complex but not complicated. The range of options and customization is just about right. I was dubious due to the lack of a color screen and other reviews and the fact that this device is not mainstream like Garmin and others but my caution was not founded in fact. Try it for yourself and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Gingerbreadman

customer_reviews.title: Good size with no aero loss
customer_reviews.text: I need a computer that had a screen i could read, and customize. I thought i was giving up some aero dynamics because od it's size but at 44.2mph, I'd say it's aero enough that i had to sit up to slow down on my tri bike. Overall i have no complaints it's the first ride and i'd recommend this product to anyone needing a legible screen
customer_reviews.author: LateEntry

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I considered the newer Roam with a color screen, but the trade off in battery life didn't seem worth it for multi-day rides (or if I just forget to charge it). I've used it to follow routes that I programed and the notifications kept me on track (or helped me find my way back on track). Easy to see in full sun.
customer_reviews.author: J Turner

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey but a good one
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a do it all computer for my bike with GPS features for long rides with good mapping and lots of readable metrics. It’s easy to set up, connect other wireless sensors and create custom views using the phone app. You have to keep it charged like any computer, but it’s hard to beat the price for this level of features.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Teachey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike computer that's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great easy to use product. The aero bar mount looked like it would fit, but was just hair to large so I stripped out the screw trying to tighten it. Wahoo sent me a replacement a few days later with barely a question. Great product along with great service = a VERY satisfied triathlete who's looking forward to using more Wahoo products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Knight

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Tried the other bike comp. the other bike comp disconnects at the middle of cycling will have connecion Issues. Wahoo GPS comp does not do all those things! Computer is very responsive easy to setup, you can record or upload your data later, battery life is awesome and rechargable, pauses asap when it senses that you rested. Worth the price and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kraeye

customer_reviews.title: Great for workouts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. We live in Ohio, and he is in Florida training for dirt bike racing season. He is able to send me info. on each one of his bicycle rides and I can know so much! Mileage, incline, heart rate, total ride time, and so much more! Great for people who want to work out hard and see how it affects them.
customer_reviews.author: mbeck

customer_reviews.title: Large display, great battery life and awesome app integration
customer_reviews.text: Large display, battery life and great compatibility with Ant+ sensors makes this forward and backwards compatible with a host of cycling gear I’m sure every cyclist collects over the years. My only criticism being an industrial designer is that the design is very bulky, seemingly unfinished with the details. The side keys require an unusually amount of actuation force, these details do not detract from the primary usage but is what keeps this from being truly a world class device
customer_reviews.author: Design perspective

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used a Garmin, but I absolutely love my ELEMNT. It’s very simple and easy to use and upload my courses,no need to plug into the computer, just download from my phone. It can be easily configured to suit your needs. The live track works much better and more consistently than garmin. And the price is very reasonable. The battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: harrington barham

customer_reviews.title: One year warranty for a reason- they don't last longer than that
customer_reviews.text: Got this product for my daily bike training. After only a year, it gets charged and then turns off after an hour - even though by it's own calculation it is nearly full. bad product.
customer_reviews.author: John Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent part of the bike package
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer that connects to your mobile phone (iPhone); easy to read and lots of post ride data. In a charity ride last weekend - the majority of the riders used Wahoo elements in different forms - no wonder. Must have for the even the part time charity rider.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Young

customer_reviews.title: Love my ELEMNT
customer_reviews.text: Love my ELEMNT. Very intuitive and user friendly. I use ride with gps to use other routes or create my own. There is a minor learning curve but it’s been very good. I’ve gotten rained on and no problems. I wish it were a little better for going off course but that hasn’t been a big issue so far. Ride with gps is the fault at times too. I’d give the ELEMNT a 90%rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Fail constantly!!!
customer_reviews.text: this product constantly fails, stays in auto pause although I use the speed and cadence sensors and does not correctly measure the altimetry either!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Castro

customer_reviews.title: He LOVED it!
customer_reviews.text: My son is getting into long distance riding and needed something to guide his journey. We live 3,000 miles away and I can still follow his rides, and no when he has returned home, or where on his ride he stopped. As a Mom, I love this, especially since he does a lot of off road riding :-).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This computer is the best on the market
customer_reviews.text: This computer is the best on the market. It beats any Garmin computer that I have used. The included app makes managing this computer very simple.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of equipment and contains all the info I ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of equipment and contains all the info I need for my ride. Two things I’d like are cadence built in and a slight faster recognition of climbing grade (takes a little bit to catch up) otherwise it’s a well worthwhile purchase. Not cheap but a good Cycling investment for those who are frequent riders.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gunsberg

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with my purchase despite the not-insignificant investment
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with my purchase despite the not-insignificant investment. The interface, display, ease of use and above all the seamless integration with both Strava and Ride with GPS makes me wish I got it sooner. Then you have navigation if you want it. Amazing job wahoo.
customer_reviews.author: KBB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike computer
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on amazon and other sites. This was the best choice for me. It works perfectly. The sensors paired within seconds and the setup was flawless. I have zero complaints after 5 rides with it. The integration with strava is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bogard

customer_reviews.title: Big screen is still king
customer_reviews.text: Having switched from Lynx Micro C super GPS.. the Elemnt looks massive next to it and for that moment it makes it seems like this might be a impulsive buy. After the first ride out with the Elemnt, all doubt is gone.. the screen size simply makes reading from this device an enjoyable affair. I don't think one can go back to anything smaller after using this device.
customer_reviews.author: Misato Fuji

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect unless I'm doing something wrong
customer_reviews.text: Loved it except that the Navi doesn't guide you until you get close by your starting point. Once you are like half a mile nearby your starting point it kicks in and works great. Will auto adust and correct itself if you go out of your route. I'm using it with komoot so it's not that big of an issue. Komoot has a great Navi turn by turn Navi.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy M.

customer_reviews.title: A great GPS cycling computer.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic GPS computer with unrivaled app support. I purchased this over the Garmin ecosystem due to the apps ability to update and customize the unit via Bluetooth. Could not be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Dill

customer_reviews.title: Reliable performance
customer_reviews.text: I've owned Garmin and Polar computers and this one is a lot better. The big difference is that I've never had problems with pairing sensors, data trasfer, GPS signal or navigating the menu. It simply works like we all expect a computer should. Reliable since day 1.
customer_reviews.author: VincentVergaraFitness

customer_reviews.title: After 1.5 years of use it goes in the garbage; Wahoo sucks.
customer_reviews.text: After just 1.5 years of using the Wahoo Element; suddenly it started shutting down while on a ride; i would restart and would keep shutting down with 70% of battery left. Did a factory reset and same problem persists.
customer_reviews.author: victor balan

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Product was listed as NEW. When received, it did not appear as NEW and I have my doubts. Purchased as a Christmas gift, so I am not sure yet. Disappointed asa of now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this bundle
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this bundle works great for me, i am able to track my performance and it really adds to my over all workout
customer_reviews.author: Richard g Wallace jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup. Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: My Elemnt was easy to set up and works as advertised however the speed sensor that shipped with my unit did not work. I was able to easily contact Wahoo customer service who quickly shipped me a replacement sensor free of charge. Now everything is working!
customer_reviews.author: David M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Unit good. Shape bad
customer_reviews.text: Went with ELEMNT bolt. Wanted to like this unit but they could have Made this aero instead of like a box. Sent it back
customer_reviews.author: L. E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Going good
customer_reviews.text: Love how it connects to my phone, just makes things easy. Battery life is on par. Auto load to Strava is a. Extra kick
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful bike computer, probably the best I’ve had!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to setup and use, pleasant and useful design. Incredible precision regarding measuring speed, altitude, gradients, position and others. I use it with my the band heart monitor and I’m amazed about the way it accurately displays all of their effort and performance information. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: works as expected...good but shy of great
customer_reviews.text: not bad but the UI does map that well to my expectations given all the over-the-top reviews I read before purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the last Bike computer you’ll buy
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent GPS computer that will also show grade of the incline. Very easy to set up and sync with your phone. I had a Garmin 500, so can’t really compare with newer products. But I live it. It is a large screen compared to Bolt. I find it more helpful to read multiple data points. Wish it talked to my Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: A. A

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Chinese gadget
customer_reviews.text: Why are these things so expensive?! Pretty nifty gadget but I just can’t justify the cost. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: jfrazier

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: works very well for both my bikes , comes with two mounts, installed one on my Mountain bike one on my cross trail bike. love that i can turn on background light for night rides very easy to read display and easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: BadCat

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life for GPS speedometer.
customer_reviews.text: Love this unit. Very easy to set up screens and attach Bluetooth accessories. Only complaint is the temperature sensor is way off...by 30 degrees at least.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H Drews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike computer😀
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer for long (200 mile) races. Long life battery. This one is for wife’s bike, I have the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far the best thing about this bike computer is the Strava Live ...
customer_reviews.text: So far the best thing about this bike computer is the Strava Live Segments integration, in fact, it got me to upgrade my Strava account just for this very feature! Now I'm really huffing and puffing on my daily routes to keep on setting new PRs!
customer_reviews.author: Dad808

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Need
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this over a month. It is excellent! Easy to set up , works like it is supposed to. The ability to tailor screens is great , has all the metrics you need. I also got the heart rate monitor. Paired flawlessly. Also worked with my Trek duo trap sensor. Love this thing.......
customer_reviews.author: Lester Ogburn

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for about 2 years now. Love the large readable screen. Not great for navigation, but can do some.
customer_reviews.author: J. Belding

customer_reviews.title: well-thought out in every way.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first wahoo 4 months ago and have purchased 3 more for my brothers who are also cyclists. The device has great battery life, full featured, and easy to link to Strava where it automatically uploads all my rides. I'm a big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Great tracker would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, have had it for over a year and works great. Zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Works as a useful and valuable tool for my cycling training
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I've added the BLU SC speed and cadence monitor, customized screens and I'm using it everyday. The only weird thing is you need to have the Elemnt on and near your phone if you want to use the Elemnt app on an iPhone and syncing can take a minute or two...but otherwise no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, run, and speak with your Kickr
customer_reviews.text: Runs my Kicker and works well. Easy to mount and use. Too cold so been all indoors for 1.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best you can get!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Should have switched from the other competitor !
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No fluff,all function... which is what you want, right?!
customer_reviews.text: Does it all and sincs up with zwift👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 App works perfect
customer_reviews.author: dan lavigne

customer_reviews.title: Great device poor map quality
customer_reviews.text: Functions and looks great. UI is decent enough but the map part is total garbage. So pixelated. Good thing I don’t use it for maps.
customer_reviews.author: MTB1977

customer_reviews.title: Great, Easy, Simple.
customer_reviews.text: Does its job exactly as it should. Easy to setup, easy to read on the ride, synchs up perfectly and without effort. Great choice for recording rides.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Willey

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived tampered.
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived with no plastic cover. Plastic for the accessories looks tampered. Missing Manuals/ Quick reference guide. Plastic protection of the unit missing. This is second hand unit that passed thru Amazon to a prime member. First time this happened to me. So disappointed right now.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P.

customer_reviews.title: Use it with Stages Power Meter and Di2 D-Fly and ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it with Stages Power Meter and Di2 D-Fly and Wahoo heart rate monitor. Flawless operation; ease of use is so far beyond the Garmin units it was a revelation.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had it long, but, it works great with no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Church

customer_reviews.title: Bike light
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this light. Its very bright and that's what he wanted. Great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Great options, easy to read. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Deb Levy

customer_reviews.title: Full Capabilty Cycling Computer.
customer_reviews.text: Great capability and simple to use. Every feature of the Elemnt has worked flawlessly for me thus far. It has also been impervious to foul weather and MTB trail conditions. Interface is simple and rugged. Links quickly to inputs like HRM or cadence meter.
customer_reviews.author: SMN

customer_reviews.title: Elemnt
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about the Elemnt. Would be nice if it was a little bit bigger and in color.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the screen...
customer_reviews.text: Great computer and easy to set up. The graphics on the screen look a little dated. After a few uses it seems to have moisture under the screen. I live in AZ. Not sure what's up with that.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxon

customer_reviews.title: Great multifunctional bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent so far, first computer so can’t complain much about features and such, nothing to compare it to.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boni

customer_reviews.title: Almost the perfect bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Is an outstanding product in every respect except one: it has ongoing problems with down loading firmware updates.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great computer, the biggest but still a bit small for old fingers
customer_reviews.author: Ken Day

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I use the wahoo Element for cycling and it’s been great so far I have lost WiFi a few times on it when way out in nowhere land .
customer_reviews.author: Sue Bickell

customer_reviews.title: great navigation computer
customer_reviews.text: small and reliable. clear navigation. a day long ride may need a power bank charging at some stage.
customer_reviews.author: oren katz

customer_reviews.title: It just works perfectly every time.
customer_reviews.text: It’s been a phenomenal computer. Really it just works and is super consistent. I have not had any issues at all with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Great bike computer
customer_reviews.text: This is the bike computer you need if you have multiple sensors using either ANT or Bluetooth. Very easy to pair unit with phone app and sensors. Contrast in bright sun is excellent so all data easy to read. Connectivity is easy to set up and automatic. Price for features makes it a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman Turnage

customer_reviews.title: Beats Garmin hands down
customer_reviews.text: Easiest bike GPS/computer to program/integrate with smartphone. Uploads via WIFI. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: christopher j davidson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and super intuitive interface. Expensive, but for me, worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: nic ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great alternative to Garmin.
customer_reviews.text: Installed it on my road bike. Display is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: KMBelza

customer_reviews.title: some nice features...but battery life and slow to boot up
customer_reviews.text: Clearly some nice features... smart design ... just would like better battery life and faster boot up time!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Prehn

customer_reviews.title: excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've done 20 rides since purchasing this computer and it has been fantastic. no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Debra H.

customer_reviews.title: Get the Ticker BPM wrist band to go with it to track calories.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little time to learn how to best operate it. I wish it linked in with the wahoo basic account. I am glad it is not a touch screen that would be difficult to operate while riding and sweating.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnard Green

customer_reviews.title: The ability to connect accessories I previously had from another company
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like is that it's not touchscreen
customer_reviews.author: Kelan B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this computer
customer_reviews.text: All the data that I could want. I especially like that my wife can track my location
customer_reviews.author: olyguy5

customer_reviews.title: Must’ve got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for less than 6 mos. No longer works.
customer_reviews.author: zoothslooth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Power2MAX power meter, uploads to Starva and Traingpeaks via Android app.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Beware the elevation is way off
customer_reviews.text: Beware, the wahoo altimeter is terrible. They say it can have a variance of 400 feet +\- every 10 miles as an acceptable margin for error.
customer_reviews.author: NHL fan

customer_reviews.title: Sent a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: What a dud. I get it today, start setting it up and at first things are moving along OK and then the screen just craps out (see pics). Reboot several times but no luck. Try charging it up (both on/off) and it shuts down. Have had it for just a few hours - fastest return ever. This is just after I returned a Hammerhead Karoo which had so many problems too. Maybe I’m not supposed to have a bike computer.
customer_reviews.author: David Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Why have a 90 degrees different connection than Garmin. Crazy
customer_reviews.author: Tor K.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure  you understand their rebate policy before you purchase
customer_reviews.text: The ELEMENT Itself is fine but the first dealins with the company were less than positive. They ran an $80 rebate that is handled by a 3rd party ..the 3rd party wants access to your bank accounts for payment and doesnt offer anyother method of payment.... great way to get out of paying rebates. I am hoping I have NOT made a mistake dealing with Wahoo in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: PDJ

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, got a refurbished unit.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a good chance to use it. Open the box and find the mounts and cables all haphazard and small smear on the screen. It happens. Glance through the start up guide while charging, pretty basic. Go to pair unit, and it says forget phone. Don't know how that's possible, unless it's been used or an open box. Finally, go to setup the WiFi and low and behold a saved wifi name. Unless they check each unit before sending out and don't factory reset. Frustrating...
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: but great on my trainer
customer_reviews.text: Too cold to really use it, but great on my trainer. So glad there is a good alternative to Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Cheerful Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Been working great for me so far
customer_reviews.text: Been working great for me so far. Pros: Accurate A lot of info displayed Good battery life Cons: Need to include better mounts
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Isidoro

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT ORDER THIS FROM AMAZON! I just received ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT ORDER THIS FROM AMAZON! I just received mine and it was an Element Mini...not a real element. What a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: Wahoo ELEMNT GPS Bike Computer
product_meta.description: Wahoo Fitness is breaking the GPS bike computer stereotype! equipped with blue tooth smart and ANT+ dual-band technology, elements pairs seamlessly with all of your cycling sensors. No more confusing menus! elements comes with a free companion App that allows you to set up your data fields, customize profiles, track performance, and share ride data effortlessly. Plus, programmable LED quick look indicators provide a quick way to see if you're on Pace with important performance metrics like speed, cadence and power.
feature_bullets: Download, pair, configure and ride! Wahoo's free companion app automates pairing and manages the configuration process for fast, frustration free setup.
Automatic route downloads and uploads when sync'd with compatible third party apps (Strava, RideWithGPS, Best Bike Split, Komoot, and more).
Automatic route downloads and uploads with compatible third party apps -Strava, RideWithGPS, Best Bike Split, Komoot, Singletracks, MTB Project+
Fully integrates with Strava Live Segments to give you accurate progress status and the Final Push to beat your goals. Battery Life - 17 hours. Waterproof Rating IPX7 (waterproof up to 5 ft)
100% Wireless - only plug it in to charge it!  Sync, acquire and push data via ANT+, Bluetooth, and Wi-Fi.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
